version.description: The version for this release. For example, '1.0.0'.

organization.description: The organization or component within the agency to which the releases listed belong. For example, '18F' or 'Navy'.

description.description: A one- or two-sentence description of the release.

URL.description: The URL of the release license, if available. If not, null should be used.

name.description: An abbreviation for the name of the license. For example, 'CC0' or 'MIT'.

usageType.description: A list of enumerated values which describes the usage permissions for the release.

exemptionText.description: If an exemption is listed in the 'usageType' field, this field should include a one- or two- sentence justification for the exemption used.

items.description: An array of keywords that will be helpful in discovering and searching for the release.

email.description: The email address for the point of contact for the release.

name.description: The name of the point of contact for the release.

URL.description: The URL to a website that can be used to reach the point of contact. For example, 'http://twitter.com/codeDotGov'.

phone.description: A phone number for the point of contact for the release.

status.description: The development status of the release.

vcs.description: A lowercase string with the name of the version control system that is being used for the release. For example, 'git'.

repositoryURL.description: The URL of the public release repository for open source repositories. This field is not required for repositories that are only available as government-wide reuse or are closed (pursuant to one of the exemptions).

homepageURL.description: The URL of the public release homepage.

downloadURL.description: The URL where a distribution of the release can be found.

disclaimerURL.description: The URL where disclaimer language regarding the release can be found.

disclaimerText.description: Short paragraph that includes disclaimer language to accompany the release.

languages.description: An array of strings with the names of the programming languages in use on the release.

laborHours.description: An estimate of total labor hours spent by your organization/component across all versions of this release. This includes labor performed by federal employees and contractors.

relatedCode.description: An array of affiliated government repositories that may be a part of the same project. For example,  relatedCode for 'code-gov-web' would include 'code-gov-api' and 'code-gov-tools'.

name.description: The name of the code repository, project, library or release.

URL.description: The URL where the code repository, project, library or release can be found.

reusedCode.description: An array of government source code, libraries, frameworks, APIs, platforms or other software used in this release. For example, US Web Design Standards, cloud.gov, Federalist, Digital Services Playbook, Analytics Reporter.

name.description: The name of the software used in this release.

URL.description: The URL where the software can be found.

partners.description: An array of objects including an acronym for each agency partnering on the release and the contact email at such agency.

name.description: The acronym describing the partner agency.

email.description: The email address for the point of contact at the partner agency.

date.description: A date object describing the release.

created.description: The date the release was created, in YYYY-MM-DD or ISO 8601 format.

lastModified.description: The date the release was modified, in YYYY-MM-DD or ISO 8601 format.

metadataLastUpdated.description: The date the metadata of the release was last updated, in YYYY-MM-DD or ISO 8601 format.
